Package cams.view

Class DisplayController

java.lang.Object
cams.view.DisplayController
public class DisplayController extends Object
A singleton class for managing and navigating all user interface elements. This class controls the current and the subsequent user interface elements displayed to the user through standard output.

To use this controller, first instantiate and initialize this singleton. 

 
 Scanner sc = new Scanner(System.in);
 DisplayController controller = DisplayController.getInstance(new WelcomeMenu(sc));

Once instantiated for the first time, the singleton instance can be retrieved through the getInstance method without passing any arguments. 

 
 DisplayController controller = DisplayController.getInstance();

Call the displayCurrent method of this singleton instance to start displaying user interface elements. This call will terminate once there are no user interface elements available to display.

Since:
2023-11-09
Version:
1.0
Author:
Gillbert Susilo Wong, Juan Frederick, Karl Devlin Chau, Pascalis Pandey, Trang Nguyen

  • Method Details

    • getInstance

      public static DisplayController getInstance(Displayable initialDisplay)
      Instantiates and initializes singleton with initial user interface element. This user interface element will be displayed first upon calling displayCurrent unless overridden by the setter setNextDisplay before first call.
      Parameters:
      initialDisplay - initial user interface element if the singleton has not been instantiated; otherwise, this is unused
      Returns:
      singleton instance

    • close

      public static void close()
      Closes the DisplayController.

    • getInstance

      public static DisplayController getInstance() throws IllegalStateException
      Returns an initialized singleton instance.
      Returns:
      singleton instance
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - when singleton has not yet been initialized with an initial user interface element

    • displayCurrent

      public void displayCurrent()
      Displays assigned user interface element. The first user interface element displayed is the initial user interface element specified during instantiation. Subsequent displayed user interface elements are specified through the setter setNextDisplay.

      This method starts displaying user interface elements through the display method of the Displayable interface until no user interface elements are available to display. Once none is available to display, this method terminates.

    • setNextDisplay

      public void setNextDisplay(Displayable displayable)
      Sets the user interface element to be displayed next. This user interface element will be displayed after the current user interface element display terminates if singleton is running displayCurrent. Otherwise, this method sets the first user interface to display upon calling displayCurrent.
      Parameters:
      displayable - user interface element to be displayed
